hasDitaContent.@value: Both inotuzumab ozogamicin and vinflunine prolong the QT interval. Most manufacturers advise avoiding the use of two or more drugs that are associated with QT prolongation. Increasing age, female sex, cardiac disease, and some metabolic disturbances (notably hypokalaemia) predispose to QT prolongation.

hasDitaContent.@value: Xipamide is predicted to cause hypokalaemia (potentially increasing the risk of torsade de pointes) when given with inotuzumab ozogamicin. Manufacturer makes no recommendation.

hasDitaContent.@value: Yellow fever vaccine, live is predicted to increase the risk of generalised infection (possibly life-threatening) when given with inotuzumab ozogamicin. UKHSA advises avoid (refer to Green Book).
